neuron

Class NeuronCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • base.ComponentCollection
        • base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • neuron.NeuronCollection<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NeuronCollectionFixedFrequency, NeuronFixed, NeuronRandom

    public abstract class NeuronCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>
extends ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>

    Base class for all collections neurons. Sub-classes should update the values of the neuronOutputs array when the step() method is invoked. See ComponentCollection for details on implementing the step() and run() methods.

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • PRE

        public static final int PRE
        Refers to a pre-synaptic Neuron or spike.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POST

        public static final int POST
        Refers to a post-synaptic Neuron or spike.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • neuronOutputs

        protected double[] neuronOutputs
        The current output values of the neurons. Range should be [0, 1].

      • neuronOutputsStale

        protected boolean neuronOutputsStale
        Flag to indicate if the neuronOutputs calculated in an Aparapi kernel have been modified on the GPU (and so would need to be transferred back if we're interested in looking at their values). This is only relevant when explicit buffer management is being used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuronCollection

        public NeuronCollection()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to set the values for pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

      • spiked

        public boolean spiked(int index)
        Returns true iff the specified neuron spiked in the last time step. The default implementation of this method returns true iff the output for the specified neuron is >= 1. Sub-classes may override this method if spiking is represented by some other condition.

      • getOutput

        public double getOutput(int index)
        Returns the output of the specified neuron for the last time step.

      • getOutputs

        public double[] getOutputs()
        Returns the underlying array of output values. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date).

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Reset the components to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if they have state variables that may be reset to an initial state. Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        reset in class ComponentCollection

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel.
        Overrides:
        step in class ComponentCollection
